intro: Phyllanthus pavonianus, commonly known as the pavonian spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant produces a latex sap that is toxic and can cause skin irritation. It typically grows in moist, disturbed habitats such as riverbanks and forest edges. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
